title: Monthly consumer Price Index ( CPI ) in India July 2019
summary: This grouped bar chart represents Consumer price index on the Y-axis. And, how the value changed throughout 6 Months for All India, Urban, and Rural.
All through the Months, similar trend was observed for Rural and Urban. In both cases, the Consumer price index have increased.
Out of all 3 groups, Rural had the highest Consumer price index in Month June and Urban had the lowest Consumer price index in Month January.
In Month June, Rural had the maximum Consumer price index and it saw the lowest in Month February out of all 6 Months.
min_summary: This is a grouped bar chart showing Consumer price index on the Y-axis throughout 6 Months for All India, Urban, and Rural on the X-axis.
All through the Months, similar trend was observed for Rural and Urban. In both cases, the Consumer price index have increased.
mid_summary: This grouped bar chart represents Consumer price index on the Y-axis. And, how the value changed throughout 6 Months for All India, Urban, and Rural.
All through the Months, similar trend was observed for Rural and Urban. In both cases, the Consumer price index have increased.
Out of all 3 groups, Rural had the highest Consumer price index in Month June and Urban had the lowest Consumer price index in Month January.
In Month June, Rural had the maximum Consumer price index and it saw the lowest in Month February out of all 6 Months.
max_summary: This grouped bar chart represents Consumer price index on the Y-axis. And, its value throughout 6 Months for All India, Urban, and Rural.
Over the 6 Months, the Consumer price index for both Rural and Urban have increased.
Out of all 3 groups, Rural had the highest Consumer price index in Month June and Urban had the lowest Consumer price index in Month January.
In Month June, Rural had the maximum Consumer price index and it saw the lowest in Month February out of all 6 Months.
There is a gap of 26.0 between the highest and lowest Consumer price index found for Rural in Month June and February.
Among all 3 groups, Urban had the gap of 41.0 between the maximum and minimum Consumer price index observed in Month June and January respectively.

In Month June, Rural had the highest Consumer price index 1436.0 among the 3 groups and in January, Urban had the lowest Consumer price index 1380.0. The second highest Consumer price index 1429.0 was observed for Rural in Month June.
On average, the Month June had the highest Consumer price index for all 3 groups All India, Urban, and Rural. Whereas January had the lowest average Consumer price index.
